Annotation.note:
The Th\'ebault-Taylor theorem: Given a triangle $ABC$ and a point $D$ on $BC$, let $c_2$ be any Th\'ebault circle with center $T$ tangent to the circumscribed circle $c_0$ of the triangle and the lines $AD$ and $BC$. Then among the inscribed and escribed circles of the triangle there is just one $c_1$ with center $I$ such that $TI$ passes through the center of another Th\'ebault circle $c_3$ tangent to $c_0$ and $AD, BC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
